item.title: TextBar - Mac App
item.description:
TextBar is a tiny but powerful app that lets you add any text to your MenuBar.
Major new version available - v3. No upgrade fee. Want to monitor TextBar from multiple machines on the web - see TextBar Live. Overview: Download app || Purchase “TextBar is an awesome app which solves a problem that I have been struggling with for at least three years” - MacStories.

item.title: Airport Picnic
item.description: Took the kids out to Manchester Airport Visitors Park. I expected them to get bored quickly, but, instead, they were still enjoying it 3 hours later. My friend came over too. We had fun and got some nice photos.

item.title: Photos
item.description: I been a keen photographer for many years. It started with a film camera, developoing black & white photos in the darkroom. The feeling when you develop your contact prints and then see the full-sized photo emerge from the chemicals; I love that process. For over 3 years I took a photo every day and posted it to Blipfoto. They was a massive help in seeing photos, as the pressure of it being daily forces you to look everywhere for a photo.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi. I live and work near Manchester, UK. For work, I’m a Principal Software Engineer at Ivanti (nee LANDESK, nee AppSense) mostly working on shipping v1 products - the three most recent projects have involved; cloud technologies (AWS, Azure), web-UI, web-services, and Windows/Mac agents. I love the dynamic and creative nature when collaborating with a team to birth new v1 products. Previously at AppSense I was Head of Research; leading a small, skilled team to identify and solve complex problems, and explore next generation markets and technologies.

item.title: Updating a website
item.description: Introduction Last time I switch the design of my blog, I switched to Hugo. After a bit of theme customization I had a pretty good working system. However, it didn’t take long until I tweaked one of the static generated output files. This tweaking continued for the next few years… until now. I’ve stuck with Hugo, but have chosen a different theme and made my customizations - mostly to make it work like a fully functioning website (with a blog), and not just a ‘single page site’, or a ‘blog with an simple about page’.
